articles.title: Rise of hate spending: Americans detest high prices but keep shopping
articles.description: People say the economy is bad and everything is too expensive, but they still spend a lot of money anyway.
articles.content: We've all been there: staring down the price of a plane ticket, a new shirt, or a bag of chips and thinking angrily to ourselves, "Jesus Christ, this did not use to cost this much." And then we buy i… [+10696 chars]

articles.title: Hualien, Taiwan earthquake: Toll on Taiwan’s chip industry
articles.description: From Taiwan to South Korea to Silicon Valley, some of the most important nodes in the global tech economy are in disaster-prone places.
articles.content: When a 7.4-magnitude earthquake hit Taiwans eastern coast on April 3, the first concern involved the risk to people and property. Here, the news was not as dire as initially feared only nine people h… [+5921 chars]

articles.title: The toughest pain points awaiting Biden at the State of the Union
articles.description: The president’s team thinks it's had a historically successful first term, delivering victories on the economy, climate, drug pricing and more. But many Americans aren’t feeling it.
articles.content: The president’s team thinks it's had a historically successful first term, delivering victories on the economy, climate, drug pricing and more. But many Americans aren’t feeling it.

articles.author: Ram Charan
articles.title: 4 vital steps that U.S. CEOs must take in the economic battle with China
articles.description: China's economy is huge, but for many companies the opportunities aren't worth the risks.
